creator: jlawson-apache@bovine.net
text:
Apache becomes permanently unresponsive if /var fills up and there is no space 
left.  All http requests simply hang, which is to say the socket stays open, 
and no data is ever transmitted back to the client.  Eventually the client will 
time out, but Apache itself does not seem to ever time out.  After /var has 
space restored, Apache requires a stop/start in order to become operational 
again.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
What is the connection between Apache and /var in your configuration?  Do you
have Apache configured to log to /var for example?  Is Apache configured to use
a piped logger which is unresponsive while there is no space in /var?

creator: jlawson-apache@bovine.net
text:
The bug seems to occur every time no matter whether file logging is being done 
directly to /var or whether Apache is set up with syslog ErrorLog (which also 
goes to /var.)  I can try putting logs somewhere else and filling /var to make 
sure it's not some other Apache feature using /var?

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Hmmm... I think that the concensus opinion is that it would be a bad idea
for apache to continue running if the eror log cannot be written.
